FuncDef:
The ds-lite address-group bind-ip-pool command binds a global static address pool to a DS-Lite instance.
The undo ds-lite address-group bind-ip-pool command deletes a global static address pool from a DS-Lite instance.
By default, no global static address pool is bound to a DS-Lite instance.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a DS-Lite IP address pool.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies an address pool ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 127.

Specifies the name of a global address pool.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Examples: [*HUAWEI-ds-lite-instance-cpe1] ds-lite address-group group1 group-id 1 bind-ip-pool pool1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A DS-Lite address pool is a collection of public IPv4 addresses. After receiving IPv4 packets sent by users, a DS-Lite device translates private IPv4 addresses carried in the IPv4 packets to public IPv4 addresses and transmits the packets to a public network. The DS-Lite address pool used in DS-Lite is determined by a specific traffic policy.
Prerequisites
A CGN global address pool has been configured.A DS-Lite instance has been created.

Precautions
The ds-lite address-group bind-ip-pool command takes effect only on the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
